Target: OntoDevice is an ontology for describing devices, their capabilities and properties.

Comment: An object designed and manufactured to perform one or more functions.
Label: Device

Comment: A microcontroller is an integrated circuit (IC) designed to handle a specific task in embedded systems.
Label: MicroController

Comment: A portable telephone that can make and receive calls over a radio frequency link.
Label: Mobile phone

Comment: A portable computer device that combines mobile telephone and computing functions into one unit.
Label: Smart phone

Comment: A transducer that converts sound into an electrical signal.
Label: Microphone

Comment: An optical instrument that can capture an image.
Label: Camera

Comment: A device used within Earth's planetary atmosphere to determine its precise geographical location.
Label: GPS device

Comment: A tag that uses a form of electronic identification technology (Bluetooth, RFID etc).
Label: Electronic tag

Comment: An electronic tag that exchanges data with a RFID reader through radio waves.
Label: RFID tag

Comment: A passive RFID tag that functions via the electromagnetic energy that gets transmitted from the RFID reader.
Label: Passive RFID tag

Comment: An active RFID tag that requires batteries for operation.
Label: Active RFID tag

Comment: A device for measuring the flow of oil.
Label: Oil meter

Comment: A device for measuring air quality.
Label: Pollution meter

Comment: A device that measure and communicate water usage from consumer to provider to facilitate water management and proper billing.
Label: Water meter

Comment: A device that measures magnetic field or magnetic dipole moment.
Label: Magnetometer

Comment: A tool that measures proper acceleration.
Label: Accelerometer

Comment: A device that measures the amount of electric energy consumed by a residence, a business, or an electrically powered device.
Label: Electricity meter

Comment: A device that is able to measure thermal energy and is usually used to measure energy from hydronic-based heating and cooling systems.
Label: Thermal energy meter

Comment: A sensor that detect minute localized changes in the force of Earth's gravity caused by variations in rock or other material's density underground.
Label: Gravity sensor

Comment: A sensor that is able to measure the concentration of carbon dioxide gas in the atmosphere.
Label: CO2 sensor

Comment: A sensor that is able to measure the level of illuminance.
Label: Illuminance sensor

Comment: A sensor that is able to measure the level of humidity in the atmosphere.
Label: Humidity sensor

Comment: A sensor used to gather information from an RFID tag, which is used to track individual objects.
Label: RFID sensor

Comment: A device that is composed of one or more Sensors together with a MicroController.
Label: Smart sensor

Comment: A device that senses pressure and converts it into an electric signal where the amount depends upon the pressure applied.
Label: Pressure sensor

Comment: A device that observes the status of another device.
Label: Status sensor

Comment: A device that is used to measure, monitor, and control processes within various industrial and commercial applications.
Label: Control sensor

Comment: A device that is used to measure the flow rate of fluids.
Label: Flow sensor

Comment: A device that is used to provide the control system with measurements of physical quantities necessary to close control loops.
Label: Feedback sensor

Comment: A device that takes a continuous distance reading and returns a corresponding analog voltage.
Label: Proximity sensor

Comment: A device that measures the sash opening of an object such as a fumehood.
Label: Sash opening sensor

Comment: A device that is usually used for the preservation of items like food via temperature regulation.
Label: Fridge

Comment: The desired or target value for an essential variable, or process value (PV) of a control system.
Label: Setpoint

Comment: The current state of something on whether it is inside or outside of a space or object.
Label: In out state

Comment: The current state of something on whether it is occupied or not.
Label: Occupied state

Comment: The current state of a switch.
Label: Switch state

Comment: An alert status that is triggered due to an abnormal condition or change in condition.
Label: Alarm state

Comment: The ratio of working power, measured in kilowatts (kW), to apparent power, measured in kilovolt amperes (kVA).
Label: Power factor

Comment: Brightness measured as a ratio.
Label: Relative brightness

Comment: A quantity that has magnitude and direction.
Label: Vector

Comment: A vector quantity that represents the strength and direction of a magnetic field.
Label: Magnetic flux density vector

Comment: A vector quantity that represents the direction and magnitude of the gravitational acceleration.
Label: Gravity vector

Comment: A vector quantity that represents the rate of change of velocity.
Label: Acceleration vector

Comment: A magnitude or intensity that must be exceeded for a certain reaction, phenomenon, result, or condition to occur or be manifested.
Label: Threshold

Comment: An option allowing a change in the method of operation of a device.
Label: Mode

Comment: A relationship between a device or technical system and the zone it is servicing or providing a service for.
Label: services

Comment: A relationship between a device and the state that it is observing.
Label: observes

Comment: A relationship between a device and a quantity or vector that it is measuring.
Label: measures

Comment: A relationship between a device and a quantity or vector that it is measuring.
Label: measures

Comment: A relationship between a device and a quantity or vector that it is measuring.
Label: measures

Comment: A relationship between a device and a quantity or vector that it is measuring.
Label: measures

Comment: A relationship between a device and its length.
Label: has length

Comment: A relationship between a device and its height.
Label: has height

Comment: A relationship between a device and its width.
Label: has width

Comment: A relationship between a device and its price.
Label: has price

Comment: A relationship between a device and its mass.
Label: has mass

Comment: A relationship between a device and its system capability.
Label: has system capability

Comment: A relationship between a device and its operating range.
Label: has operating range

Comment: A relationship between a device and its survival range.
Label: has survival range

Comment: A relationship between a device and a setpoint.
Label: has setpoint

Comment: A relationship between a device and a control parameter.
Label: has control parameter

Comment: A relationship between a device and a feedback parameter.
Label: has feedback parameter

Domain: Threshold UNION Setpoint UNION http://www.w3.org/ns/ssn/systems/OperatingProperty UNION http://www.w3.org/ns/ssn/systems/SystemProperty UNION Device UNION http://www.w3.org/ns/ssn/systems/Condition UNION https://w3id.org/bot#Zone UNION http://www.theworldavatar.com/ontology/ontocape/chemical_process_system/CPS_behavior/behavior.owl#MaterialAmount UNION http://www.theworldavatar.com/ontology/ontocape/chemical_process_system/CPS_function/process.owl#UnitOperation UNION http://www.theworldavatar.com/ontology/ontocape/material/phase_system/phase_system.owl#PhaseSystem UNION http://www.theworldavatar.com/ontology/ontocape/chemical_process_system/CPS_behavior/behavior.owl#ConvectiveTransportRate
Comment: A relationship between something (it could be a device or space, a setpoint, an operating property etc) and the quantity it represents or has.
Label: has quantity

Comment: A relationship between a device and its screen brightness.
Label: has screen brightness

Comment: A relationship describing the degree or intensity of heat present in a substance, object or space.
Label: has temperature

Comment: A relationship describing the relative humidity of a substance, object or space.
Label: has relative humidity

Comment: A relationship describing the pressure exerted on a substance, object or a space.
Label: has pressure

Comment: A relationship that describes a device being attached to another physical element or object.
Label: is attached to

Comment: A relationship that describes a device being connected to another device where the operation of one device will affect the other.
Label: is connected to

Comment: A relationship that describes a device sending a signal to another device.
Label: sends signal to

Comment: A relationship that describes a device's location.
Label: has geo location

Comment: A relationship that describes the type of substance that a device is sensing or observing.
Label: senses substance

Comment: A relationship that describes a person or organization possessing a device.
Label: has a

Comment: A relationship that defines the component of a vector in x-direction.
Label: has X component

Comment: A relationship that defines the component of a vector in y-direction.
Label: has Y component

Comment: A relationship that defines the component of a vector in z-direction.
Label: has Z component

Comment: A relationship that defines the component of a vector in x-direction.
Label: has X component

Comment: A relationship that defines the component of a vector in y-direction.
Label: has Y component

Comment: A relationship that defines the component of a vector in z-direction.
Label: has Z component

Comment: A relationship that defines the component of a vector in x-direction.
Label: has X component

Comment: A relationship that defines the component of a vector in y-direction.
Label: has Y component

Comment: A relationship that defines the component of a vector in z-direction.
Label: has Z component

Comment: A relationship that defines the component of a vector in x-direction.
Label: has X component

Comment: A relationship that defines the component of a vector in y-direction.
Label: has Y component

Comment: A relationship that defines the component of a vector in z-direction.
Label: has Z component

Comment: A relationship that defines a minimum threshold applied to a zone (e.g. temperature of a room).
Label: has min threshold

Comment: A relationship that defines a maximum threshold applied to a zone (e.g. temperature of a room).
Label: has max threshold

Comment: A relationship that describes the amount of cumulative energy used or consumed during a process or by a device.
Label: has cumulative energy consumption

Comment: A relationship that describes the mode that a device is operating in.
Label: has mode

Comment: A relationship that describes the ID assigned to a device.
Label: has ID
